snippet: Louis Head, stepfather of the slain black teenager, said he was “full of raw emotions” the night that a grand jury’s decision was announced.
abstract: Louis Head, stepfather of slain black teenager Michael Brown, apologizes for inflammatory comments he made in public after grand jury did not indict Ferguson, Mo, police officer Darren Wilson in Brown's fatal shooting; St Louis County police are investigating Head's comments as part of broader inquiry into multiple incidents of arson and destruction of property following grand jury decision.
lead_paragraph: Louis Head, stepfather of the slain black teenager, said he was “full of raw emotions” the night that a grand jury’s decision was announced.

headline.main: Michael Brown’s Stepfather Apologizes for Outburst in Ferguson
headline.print_headline: Stepfather Apologizes for Outburst in Ferguson
